title: New & Video: Wilco – ‘Art of Almost’ studio clip
content:
Earlier today don’t-even-mention-alt-country superstars Wilco posted up a video on their website teasingly titled ‘Almost’, and even more teasingly taglined ‘Something new…’

For this particular follower of Jeff Tweedy and co, the two years since 2009’s excellent Wilco (The Album) have been long and torturous. So it’s nice to know that the mysteriously titled (or maybe not, as it turns out) ‘Almost’ video is actually a studio clip of the recording of the track Art of Almost, which opens the band’s forthcoming record The Whole Love, their eighth studio album to date.

The Whole Love will be available on 26th September, on Wilco‘s own dBpm label. A pre-order service and the album’s tracklist, amongst other things, can be found here. Meanwhile, here’s Nels Cline demonstrating that guitar freakouts can still be, like, way cool, and Tweedy ordering a Chinese, presumably…

(Photo © Zoran Orlic 2011)
author: 5e9b68b27a1236eccfeb1d3c
